executive_summary: The patient is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) presenting with an HbA1c of 8.6%, indicating suboptimal glycemic control. Key priorities include improving glycemic management and addressing lifestyle factors to reduce cardiovascular risk.

labs_table.comment: Above target for high CV risk

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is above the target for T1DM, indicating a need for improved management.
interpretation.plan: Initiate insulin therapy and consider referral to a diabetes education program.

interpretation.assessment: LDL is above the target for high cardiovascular risk.
interpretation.plan: Implement dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on low glycemic index foods, limit saturated fats and sugars.
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control to manage carbohydrate intake.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia.

patient_goals: Lower LDL to <2.0 mmol/L within 12 months
Increase physical activity to 150 minutes per week within 3 months

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Consider statin therapy for elevated LDL cholesterol.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c and lipid levels, review lifestyle changes.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM, HbA1c 8.6%, LDL 2.5 mmol/L. Initiate insulin therapy and lifestyle modifications. Follow-up in 3 months.
